text: Nicholas Charles Sparks (born December 31, 1965) is an American novelist, screenwriter, and philanthropist. He has published twenty one novels and two non-fiction books, all of which have been The New York Times bestsellers list. He was born in Omaha, Nebraska. He is known for writing The Notebook which eventually became a movie in 2004. ==References== Category:1965 births Category:Living people Category:American novelists Category:American philanthropists Category:American screenwriters Category:Writers from Omaha, Nebraska
title: Nicholas Sparks
